I've finished downloading this torrent and am now seeding as best as I can (100KiB/s-ish is the best I can do, I'm at a ratio of 2, but plan to keep going for as long as there are more leechers than seeders).

The quality is great and I didn't have sound sync problems playing in Ubuntu 11.04 using mplayer (just the version you get from Software Centre).

I have a very old laptop with an Intel Pentium Dual-Core T2080 processor (which runs at a clock speed of 1.73GHz) and integrated graphics only.  Which is rubbish.  This kind of laptop would be the sort you'd get for something like Â£450 in 2006-7 (and, indeed, I did).  I downloaded this out of curiosity, given the aggressive compression, and was pleasantly surprised to find that my laptop can play it just fine!  So if you're worried about whether or not you can play these 1080p files, if your machine is newer than 2006 or cost you more than Â£450, the answer is, "Yeah, you can play these files."

Dear User who doesn't know how torrents work,

When you download bits of information, via bit torrent, you are getting them from other people who are uploading these bits of information. If no one uploads, then no one gets to download. This includes the 100 of you that are leeching and not seeding. There is a special place in hell for non-seeders, lol.
